intro: Bauhinia hekouensis, commonly known as the Hekou bauhinia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, bipinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
